result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric W Juster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit to DNA sample forthwith.
Court waives all fees/costs.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Refund of bond posted. Court waived costs.: William H Juster

Defendant Eric W Juster in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea quesitionaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts change of plea and finds defendant guilty. Court renders sentence and waives all court fees/costs.
w/condition: bond of $250 reinstated, not operate m/v without valid dl
same conditions as previously set

Defendant Eric W Juster appears by video from Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alme-Boaz in court. Counsel represents defendant and addresses court as to non-appearance of last hearing. Defendant was in custody in Marinette County at that time. Counsel requests to unforfeit bail. Court vacates forfeiture of signature bond and reinstates cash bail of $250. Defendant will be held here until next hearing.  Further proceedings scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Per Dispatch, subject is in custody on warrant
of bail/bond forfeiture

Attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel unaware of why defendant not present and requests warrant be stayed until next hearing, Based on non-appearance the court will forfeit any bail and issue warrant.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-09-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Eric W Juster in court with Attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Alme-Boaz requests an adjourment.

Defendant Eric W Juster in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea. Pretrial at convenience of parties.  Further proceedings scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Case recalled having been previously called with a warrant to be issued. Court withdraws warrant. Defendant Eric W Juster in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail recommendation given.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant Eric W Juster not in court. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders arrest warrant issued.
Plea hearing at 11-16-2015 01:45 pm

Defendant Eric W Juster in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Complaint read, defendant advised of penalties and finds probable cause on face of the complaint. Defendant requests additional time to contact the public defender's office.  Defendant released without bail.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
